meanings.sent1: The sternmost seat on the bus was the last one available.
meanings.sent2: The sternmost house on the street had a beautiful view of the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The sternmost squirrel in the park was known for its love of acorns.
meanings.sent4: Her sternmost warning to the students made them realize the seriousness of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The sternmost tree in the forest stood tall and proud, overlooking the rest of the trees.

meanings.definition: Located at the rear of a ship
meanings.sent1: The sternmost cabin on the cruise ship offered a peaceful view of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The sailors gathered at the sternmost part of the ship to watch the sunset.
meanings.sent3: The sternmost pirate on the ship was known for his love of treasure hunting.
meanings.sent4: The captain's quarters were located in the sternmost section of the ship.
meanings.sent5: The sternmost flag fluttered proudly in the wind, marking the ship's end.
